benchmark_details.name: GRAPH PATTERN COMPREHENSION
benchmark_details.overview: This work introduces a comprehensive benchmark to assess LLMs' capabilities in graph pattern tasks. It evaluates whether LLMs can understand graph patterns based on either terminological or topological descriptions, and tests their capacity to autonomously discover graph patterns from data.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Evaluate LLMs' understanding of graph patterns in synthetic and real-world applications.

data.source: Both synthetic datasets generated for various tasks and real-world datasets including molecular graphs, social networks, and biological networks.
data.size: 1,893 undirected graphs and 1,313 directed graphs in total; diverse sizes for different tasks.
data.annotation: Graphs and patterns are generated based on predefined structures, with labeled graphs utilized in real-world datasets.

methods: Evaluation on various LLMs through tasks structured to assess graph pattern comprehension.
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the correct identification of graph patterns, comparison of generated patterns with expected patterns.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better understanding and generation of graph patterns by LLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: Reported results across various models indicate performance varying significantly across tasks and patterns.
methodology.validation: Results are validated through comparative analysis with known benchmarks in graph theory.

harm: Potential bias in understanding graph patterns based on underlying data used for training.
